channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Pioneering African-American baseball player Ron Teasley has died at 99
item.description: Ron Teasley, one of the last remaining veterans of the Negro Leagues, has died. A native of Detroit, Teasley sparkled on the baseball diamond. He was 99.
item.content:encoded: Ron Teasley, one of the last remaining veterans of the Negro Leagues, has died. A native of Detroit, Teasley sparkled on the baseball diamond. He was 99.
item.dc:creator: Debbie Elliott

item.title: A group of mudlarkers see what's hiding by a Philadelphia creek
item.description: "Mudlarking" is the hobby of searching for keepsakes along muddy creek banks. An old marble is enough to get people outdoors for this pursuit best performed in the winter.
item.content:encoded: "Mudlarking" is the hobby of searching for keepsakes along muddy creek banks. An old marble is enough to get people outdoors for this pursuit best performed in the winter.
item.dc:creator: Buffy Gorrilla

item.title: American dream denied: A Frenchman's ICE nightmare
item.description: A young French tennis coach who once lived the American dream describes being detained, shackled and expelled under the Trump administration's tightened border rules.
item.content:encoded: A young French tennis coach who once lived the American dream describes being detained, shackled and expelled under the Trump administration's tightened border rules.
item.dc:creator: Eleanor Beardsley

item.title: The who, what, and how of the new Trump Accounts
item.description: NPR's Juana Summers speaks with Ron Lieber, financial columnist for The New York Times, about the ins and outs of the newly created Trump Accounts.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Juana Summers speaks with Ron Lieber, financial columnist for The New York Times, about the ins and outs of the newly created Trump Accounts.
item.dc:creator: Kathryn Fink

item.title: Measles outbreak in South Carolina continues but may be slowing
item.description: South Carolina released the newest numbers on its measles outbreak, and there's news of other cases around the country.
item.content:encoded: South Carolina released the newest numbers on its measles outbreak, and there's news of other cases around the country.
item.dc:creator: Maria Godoy

item.title: Congress fully funds health agencies, restoring RFK Jr.'s cuts
item.description: The bipartisan budget that Trump just signed is a 180-turn from how funding for health agencies were slashed in 2025. But grantees and people in the agencies remain suspicious.
item.content:encoded: The bipartisan budget that Trump just signed is a 180-turn from how funding for health agencies were slashed in 2025. But grantees and people in the agencies remain suspicious.
item.dc:creator: Selena Simmons-Duffin

item.title: Scientists say this brain network may explain range of Parkinson's symptoms
item.description: Parkinson's disease can affect sleep, thinking and smell, as well as movement. A new study may explain why.
item.content:encoded: Parkinson's disease can affect sleep, thinking and smell, as well as movement. A new study may explain why.
item.dc:creator: Jon Hamilton

item.title: Border czar Tom Homan to immediately reduce federal agents in Minnesota by 700
item.description: The Trump administration is pulling hundreds of ICE agents from Minnesota — and allowing for the possibility of further drawdowns. Border czar Tom Homan says about 2-thousand officers will remain.
item.content:encoded: The Trump administration is pulling hundreds of ICE agents from Minnesota — and allowing for the possibility of further drawdowns. Border czar Tom Homan says about 2-thousand officers will remain.
item.dc:creator: Martin Kaste

item.title: The Trump administration's efforts to end TPS for Haitians was blocked — for now
item.description: A federal judge has blocked the Trump administration's efforts to revoke Temporary Protected Status for some 330,000 Haitian immigrants in the U.S., for now.
item.content:encoded: A federal judge has blocked the Trump administration's efforts to revoke Temporary Protected Status for some 330,000 Haitian immigrants in the U.S., for now.
item.dc:creator: Jeffrey Pierre

item.title: Lawsuit from families of men killed in boat strikes is the first to reach U.S. court
item.description: Relatives of two Trinidadian men killed in a U.S. airstrike last year are suing over what they call extrajudicial killings. It's the first such case to land in an American courthouse.
item.content:encoded: Relatives of two Trinidadian men killed in a U.S. airstrike last year are suing over what they call extrajudicial killings. It's the first such case to land in an American courthouse.
item.dc:creator: Carrie Johnson
